title: September Jobs Report Injects More Uncertainty Into Fed’s December Decision
summary: Policymakers at the central bank are at odds over the need to cut interest rates for a third straight meeting, as inflation picks up again and the labor market slows down.

title: Walmart Sales Rise as Shoppers Look For Savings
summary: The retailer increased its guidance for the year, anticipating more price-conscious shoppers would flock to its stores.

title: Family Affair: Commerce Secretary’s Sons Cash In on A.I. Frenzy
summary: Howard Lutnick is helping push data center projects. His family companies are profiting from them.

title: Lawsuit Challenges Trump Administration Over $1.8 Million in Immigration Fines
summary: A class-action suit accuses the Trump administration of weaponizing civil penalties to force undocumented migrants to self-deport through enormous penalties.

title: California Has a Legal Clause for Housing That Could Put NIMBYs in a Corner
summary: For years, the state has been nudging its cities to build housing to address a severe shortage. Maybe what they needed was a shove.

title: Cheney Remembered for Transforming National Security and Standing Against Trump
summary: As the former vice president is honored at Washington National Cathedral on Thursday, many eyes are focused on who came — and who did not.

title: Trump Was Not Invited to Cheney’s Memorial Service
summary: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, a once-powerful Republican, turned on Mr. Trump last year by announcing he would vote for Vice President Kamala Harris.

title: The Grand Ole Opry at 100
summary: As the country music institution celebrates a century of its radio broadcast, listen to how the show defined the culture — and was reshaped by it — decade by decade.

title: Trump Approves the Epstein Files Release, but Some May Be Withheld
summary: The president sought to take credit for the legislation, despite months of pressure to kill it. The bill has significant exceptions that could mean many documents would stay confidential.

title: Former Harvard President Lawrence Summers Has Come Back From Scandals. Will This Be His Last?
summary: The former Harvard president has come back from controversy before, but revelations in new Epstein emails are threatening his omnipresence in public life.

title: Wyden Presses for Investigation Into JPMorgan Chase and Epstein
summary: Senator Ron Wyden, an Oregon Democrat, wants to examine how the nation’s largest bank handled the reporting of more than $1 billion in suspicious transactions.

title: To Meld A.I. With Supercomputers, National Labs Are Picking Up the Pace
summary: A.I. has added urgency to the U.S. national laboratories that have been sites of cutting-edge scientific research, leading to deals with tech giants like Nvidia to speed up.

title: Did Nvidia Do Enough to Chill A.I. Bubble Fears?
summary: The chipmaker at the center of the artificial intelligence boom reported blowout results. But that hasn’t resolved some key questions behind the tech rally.

title: Ukraine and Europe Chafe at Being Excluded From U.S.-Russian Peace Plan
summary: Some in Kyiv expressed confusion over the Trump administration’s multiple diplomatic tracks as Washington tries to revive negotiations.

title: Move Over, Netflix: Ukraine’s Corruption Investigators Bring the Drama
summary: The country’s anti-graft agencies have taken a cinematic approach to revealing a scandal that has touched President Volodymyr Zelensky’s inner circle.

title: Trump Meeting With Saudi Prince Showcased Prince’s Makeover, and America’s
summary: Mohammed bin Salman was briefly a global pariah after the killing of a Saudi dissident. But he has rebuilt his image as a deal-maker and influential investor.

title: After a Mysterious Death, a Family’s Quest for Answers Leads to a Tick
summary: A JetBlue pilot’s illness looked like food poisoning, but it was actually an increasingly common tick-borne meat allergy that can be fatal.

title: Ambassador Huckabee Held Meeting With Jonathan Pollard, Ex-Spy, at U.S. Embassy in Israel
summary: Jonathan J. Pollard, who was convicted of espionage, said in an interview that the meeting, which was highly unusual for a U.S. diplomat to attend, had been friendly.

title: Justice Democrats Re-Emerge in New York to Try to Unseat Espaillat
summary: The group, which powered Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez’s rise in 2018, is backing Darializa Avila Chevalier’s bid to unseat Representative Adriano Espaillat.

title: Mamdani and Tisch Agreed to Work Together. Here’s Where They Differ.
summary: The New York City mayor-to-be, Zohran Mamdani, and the head of the Police Department, Jessica Tisch, have gaps to bridge on crime and policing.

title: After 167 Years in New York, a Priceless Coin Collection Heads to Toledo
summary: The doubloons, dollars and denarii of the American Numismatic Society will leave their overlooked home in Manhattan for a more welcoming headquarters on the campus of the Toledo Museum of Art.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Was Not on Our Bingo Card
summary: Have we been selling her short? Is she paving the way to the after-Trump?

title: Understanding the Right’s Antisemitic Turn
summary: It’s deeper than Nick Fuentes.

title: Power and Wealth in New York
summary: We’re looking at two local stories that have national implications.

title: What Questions Do You Have About U.S. Immigration Policies?
summary: “Ask a Correspondent” will take your questions to Hamed Aleaziz, our immigration reporter.

title: Iran Withdraws From Deal for International Nuclear Inspections
summary: Iran’s foreign minister said his country would halt plans for a reinstatement of nuclear inspections at a time of heightened concern over Iran’s enriched uranium.

title: These Books Were Judged by Their A.I. Covers, and Disqualified
summary: A New Zealand book competition dropped two of a publisher’s books because they had A.I.-generated covers. The publisher and the designer pushed back.

title: Tennessee House Race Rivets Democrats and Worries Republicans
summary: Still the favorites, Republicans have grown nervous about a House special election that could show whether the political environment continues to shift leftward.

title: As the World Pursues Clean Power, Millions Still Have No Power at All
summary: Just outside Belém, the Amazonian city where the world is meeting to discuss climate change, electricity is a very recent arrival.
